column1: CMOR Table Lmon: Monthly Mean Land Fields, Including
Physical, Vegetation, Soil, and Biogeochemical Variables
(All fields should be saved on the atmospheric grid; unless otherwise indicated, values are averaged over only the land portion of each grid cell and report 0.0 where land fraction is 0.)

column4: comment
column8: unconfirmed or proposed standard name
column10: cell_methods

column2: Moisture in Upper 0.1 m of Soil Column
column4: Compute the mass of water in all phases in the upper 0.1 meters of soil.
column10: time: mean area: mean where land

column4: Compute the mass per unit area  (summed over all soil layers) of water in all phases.
column10: time: mean area: mean where land

column4: Compute the mass (summed over all all layers) of frozen water.
column10: time: mean area: mean where land

column4: Compute the total surface runoff leaving the land portion of the grid cell.
column10: time: mean area: mean where land

column4: compute the total runoff (including "drainage" through the base of the soil model) leaving the land portion of the grid cell.
column10: time: mean area: mean where land

column4: Report the precipitation flux that is intercepted by the vegetation canopy (if present in model) before reaching the ground.
column10: time: mean area: mean where land

column4: Report the canopy evaporation+sublimation (if present in model).
column10: time: mean area: mean where land

column4: includes sublimation.
column10: time: mean area: mean where land
time: mean area: mean where land

column4: in each soil layer, the mass of water in all phases, including ice.
column8: water_content_of_soil_layer
column10: time: mean area: mean where land

column4: Temperature of each soil layer.  Report as "missing" for grid cells occupied entirely by "sea".
column10: time: mean

column4: fraction of entire grid cell  that is covered by trees.
column5: I think we need to add a scalar coordinate variable where some indication of "tree" needs to be included.
column10: time: mean

column4: fraction of entire grid cell that is covered by natural grass.
column5: I think we need to add a scalar coordinate variable where some indication of "tree" needs to be included.
column10: time: mean

column4: fraction of entire grid cell  that is covered by shrub.
column5: I think we need to add a scalar coordinate variable where some indication of "tree" needs to be included.
column10: time: mean

column4: fraction of entire grid cell  that is covered by crop.
column5: I think we need to add a scalar coordinate variable where some indication of "tree" needs to be included.
column10: time: mean

column4: fraction of entire grid cell  that is covered by anthropogenic pasture.
column5: I think we need to add a scalar coordinate variable where some indication of "tree" needs to be included.
column10: time: mean

column4: fraction of entire grid cell  that is covered by bare soil.
column5: I think we need to add a scalar coordinate variable where some indication of "tree" needs to be included.
column10: time: mean

column2: Fraction of Grid Cell that is Land but Neither Vegetation-Covered nor Bare Soil
column4: fraction of entire grid cell  that is land and is covered by "non-vegetation" and "non-bare-soil" (e.g., urban, ice, lakes, etc.)
column5: I think we need to add a scalar coordinate variable where some indication of "tree" needs to be included.
column10: time: mean

column4: fraction of entire grid cell  that is covered by burnt vegetation.
column5: I think we need to add a scalar coordinate variable where some indication of "tree" needs to be included.
column10: time: mean

column2: Carbon Mass in Products of Land Use Change
column8: PF: carbon_in_products_of_luc NOT PROPOSED
column10: time: mean area: mean where land

column4: projected leaf area per unit of ground area (i.e., only the land portion of the grid cell), expressed as a proper fraction (not a percentage)
column10: time: mean area: mean where land

column2: Carbon Mass Flux out of Atmosphere due to Gross Primary Production on Land
column8: gross_primary_productivity_of_carbon? gross_primary_production
column10: time: mean area: mean where land

column2: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to Autotrophic (Plant) Respiration on Land
column8: plant_respiration_carbon_flux? autotrophic_plant_respiration
column10: time: mean area: mean where land

column2: Carbon Mass Flux out of Atmosphere due to Net Primary Production on Land
column4: needed for models that do not compute GPP (if any)
column5: should this be "into Atmosphere " rather than "out of Atmosphere"?
column8: net_primary_productivity_of_carbon?  net_primary_production
column10: time: mean area: mean where land

column2: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to Heterotrophic Respiration on Land
column8: heterotrophic_respiration_carbon_flux? heterotrophic_respiration
column10: time: mean area: mean where land

column2: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to CO2 Emission from Fire
column4: CO2 emissions (expressed as a carbon mass flux) from natural fires + human ignition fires as calculated by the fire module of the DGVM, but excluding any CO2 flux from fire included in fLuc, defined below (CO2 Flux to Atmosphere from Land Use Change).
column8: PF: co2_emission_from_fire NOT PROPOSED - recommend tendency_of_atmosphere_mass_content_of_carbon_dioxide_due_to_biomass_burning for consistency with chemistry names
column10: time: mean area: mean where land

column2: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to Grazing on Land
column8: PF: co2_flux_to_atmosphere_from_grazing NOT PROPOSED - recommend tendency_of_atmosphere_mass_content_of_carbon_dioxide_due_to_grazing for consistency with chemistry names
column10: time: mean area: mean where land

column2: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to Crop Harvesting
column8: PF: co2_flux_to_atmosphere_from_crop_harvesting NOT PROPOSED - recommend tendency_of_atmosphere_mass_content_of_carbon_dioxide_due_to_crop_harvesting for consistency with chemistry names
column10: time: mean area: mean where land

column2: Net Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to Land Use Change
column4: human changes to land (excluding forest regrowth) accounting possibly for different time-scales related to fate of the wood, for example.
column8: PF: co2_flux_to_atmosphere_from_land_use_change NOT PROPOSED - recommend tendency_of_atmosphere_mass_content_of_carbon_dioxide_due_to_land_use_change for consistency with chemistry names
column10: time: mean area: mean where land

column2: Carbon Mass Flux out of Atmosphere due to Net Biospheric Production on Land
column4: This is the net mass flux of carbon between land and atmosphere calculated as photosynthesis MINUS the sum of  plant and soil respiration, carbonfluxes  from fire, harvest, grazing  and land use change. Positive flux  is into the land.
column8: PF: net_biospheric_productivity  Is this the same as net_primary_productivity_of_carbon (also in cell G53)?
column10: time: mean area: mean where land

column2: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation to Litter
column8: PF: carbon_flux_from_vegetation_into_litter total_carbon_flux_from_vegetation_to_litter
column10: time: mean area: mean where land

column2: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Litter to Soil
column8: PF: carbon_flux_from_litter_into_soil total_carbon_flux_from_litter_to_soil NOT PROPOSED - recommend carbon_flux_from_litter_into_soil for consistency with water and salt flux names
column10: time: mean area: mean where land

column2: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation Directly to Soil
column4: In some models part of carbon (e.g., root exudate) can go directly into the soil pool without entering litter.
column8: PF: carbon_flux_into_soil_from_plants_excluding_litter total_carbon_flux_from_vegetation_directly_to_soil NOT PROPOSED - recommend carbon_flux_into_soil_from_plants_excluding_litter for consistency with water and salt flux names and runoff names
column10: time: mean area: mean where land

column5: This field and some of the following may sum to yield some of the more generic carbon pool totals given above.
column8: carbon_in_leaves NOT PROPOSED - recommend leaf_carbon_content for consistency with soil_carbon_content, etc. PF agrees.
column10: time: mean area: mean where land

column4: including sapwood and hardwood.
column8: carbon_in_wood NOT PROPOSED - recommend wood_carbon_content for consistency with soil_carbon_content, etc.  PF agrees
column10: time: mean area: mean where land

column4: including fine and coarse roots.
column8: carbon_in_roots NOT PROPOSED - recommend root_carbon_content for consistency with soil_carbon_content, etc.  PF agrees.
column10: time: mean area: mean where land

column2: Carbon Mass in Other Living Compartments on Land
column4: e.g., labile, fruits, reserves, ....
column8: carbon_in_other_living_compartments NOT PROPOSED - this should also be a carbon_content name, and we probably need something more specific than 'other_living_compartments' but I'm stuck for a suggestion here. PF agrees.
column10: time: mean area: mean where land

column2: Carbon Mass in Coarse Woody Debris
column8: carbon_in_coarse_woody_debris - NOT PROPOSED - recommend coarse_wood_debris_carbon_content or just wood_debris_carbon_content for consistency with soil_carbon_content, etc.  PF agrees.
column10: time: mean area: mean where land

column8: PF: aboveground_litter_carbon_content carbon_in_aboveground_litter NOT PROPOSED - recommend surface_litter_carbon_content for consistency with soil_carbon_content, etc. and runoff names
column10: time: mean area: mean where land

column8: PF: belowground_litter_carbon_content carbon_in_aboveground_litter N.B. Should this be belowground litter? NOT PROPOSED - recommend subsurface_litter_carbon_content for consistency with soil_carbon_content, etc. and runoff names
column10: time: mean area: mean where land

column2: Carbon Mass in Fast Soil Pool
column4: fast is meant as lifetime of less than 10 years for  reference climate conditions (20C, no water limitations).
column8: carbon_in_fast_soil_pool NOT PROPOSED - recommend fast_soil_pool_carbon_content for consistency with soil_carbon_content, etc. PF agrees.
column10: time: mean area: mean where land

column2: Carbon Mass in Medium Soil Pool
column4: medium is meant as lifetime of more than than 10 years and less than 100 years for  reference climate conditions (20C, no water limitations)
column8: medium_soil_pool NOT PROPOSED - recommend medium_soil_pool_carbon_content for consistency with soil_carbon_content, etc.  PF agrees.
column10: time: mean area: mean where land

column2: Carbon Mass in Slow Soil Pool
column4: fast is meant as lifetime of more than 100 years for  reference climate conditions (20C, no water limitations)
column8: carbon_in_slow_soil_pool NOT PROPOSED - recommend slow_soil_pool_carbon_content for consistency with soil_carbon_content, etc.  PF agrees.
column10: time: mean area: mean where land

column4: using each individual ESM PFT definition.   This includes natural PFTs, anthropogenic PFTs, bare soil, lakes, urban areas, etc.   Sum of all should equal the fraction of the grid-cell that is land.  Note that the "types" will be model dependent and for each type there should be a full description of the PFT (plant functional type).   To facilitate model comparison, it is also requested that the aggregated land cover types called for in lines 25 to 32 be archived (but not in this variable).
column5: need to explain how to define vegtype.
column10: time: mean

column4: Agregation of model PFTs as defined in 1st priority to aid model intercomparison.  This is the fraction of the entire grid cell  that is covered by "total primary deciduous trees."
column5: I think we need to add a scalar coordinate variable where some indication of "tree" needs to be included.
column10: time: mean

column2: Total Primary Evergreen Tree Cover Fraction
column4: fraction of entire grid cell  that is covered by primary evergreen trees.
column8: total_primary_evergreen_tree_cover_fraction
column10: time: mean

column2: Total Secondary Deciduous Tree Cover Fraction
column4: fraction of entire grid cell  that is covered by secondary deciduous trees.
column8: total_secondary_deciduous_tree_cover_fraction
column10: time: mean

column2: Total Secondary Evergreen Tree Cover Fraction
column4: fraction of entire grid cell  that is covered by secondary evergreen trees.
column8: total_secondary_evergreen_tree_cover_fraction
column10: time: mean

column4: fraction of entire grid cell  that is covered by C3 PFTs (including grass, crops, and trees).
column8: total_c3_pft_cover_fraction
column10: time: mean

column4: fraction of entire grid cell  that is covered by C4 PFTs (including grass and crops).
column8: total_c4_pft_cover_fraction
column10: time: mean

column2: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to Growth Autotrophic Respiration on Land
column4: This flux and the one in the following row provide a breakdown of the higher priority "Autotrophic (Plant) Respiration" in an earlier row of this table; thus the sum should be identical to that.
column8: PF: for consistency with row 40: growth_autothrophic_respiration NOT PROPOSED - recommend plant_respiration_carbon_flux_due_to_growth for consistency with row 52
column10: time: mean area: mean where land

column2: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to Maintenance Autotrophic Respiration on Land
column4: This flux and the one in the previous row provide a breakdown of the higher priority "Autotrophic (Plant) Respiration" in an earlier row of this table; thus the sum should be identical to that.
column8: PF: for consistency with row 40: maintenance_autothrophic_respiration NOT PROPOSED - recommend plant_respiration_carbon_flux_due_to_maintenance for consistency with row 52 (what is 'maintenance'?)
column10: time: mean area: mean where land

column2: Carbon Mass Flux due to NPP Allocation to Leaf
column4: This is the rate of carbon uptake by leaves due to NPP
column8: PF: net_primary_production_allocated_into_leaves npp_allocation_to_leaf NOT PROPOSED - what is npp? Don't understand this quantity.
column10: time: mean area: mean where land

column2: Carbon Mass Flux due to NPP Allocation to Wood
column4: This is the rate of carbon uptake by wood due to NPP
column8: PF: net_primary_production_allocated_into_wood npp_allocation_to_wood NOT PROPOSED - what is npp? Don't understand this quantity.
column10: time: mean area: mean where land

column2: Carbon Mass Flux due to NPP Allocation to Roots
column4: This is the rate of carbon uptake by roots due to NPP
column8: PF: net_primary_production_allocated_into_roots npp_allocation_to_root NOT PROPOSED - what is npp? Don't understand this quantity.
column10: time: mean area: mean where land

column2: Net Carbon Mass Flux out of Atmophere due to Net Ecosystem Productivity on Land.
column4: Natural flux of CO2 (expressed as a mass flux of carbon) from the atmosphere to the land calculated as the difference between uptake associated will photosynthesis and the release of CO2 from the sum of plant and soil respiration and fire.  Positive flux is into the land.  emissions from natural fires + human ignition fires as calculated by the fire module of the DGVM, but excluding any CO2 flux from fire included in fLuc, defined below (CO2 Flux to Atmosphere from Land Use Change).
column8: net_ecosystem_productivity_of_carbon_dioxide
column10: time: mean area: mean where land
